61894562
>>61894267
class of 2008

initial was 20k in 2017, ATH was 2.1M (dec 2022)

i have bought (4) coins - BTC, ETH, LINK, PEPE... everything has made me money

biggest disappointment... i guess ETH because it's only done a 2x/3x for me?

the biggest fumble was just selling too early... i cashed out LINK at a 17x and it did a 290x... cashed out PEPE at an 8x and it did a 25x

i still think to this day about how the LINK marines spamming dumb memes in 2017 was the best financial advice i ever received in my life

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61894682
>>61894267
>class of
2017
>initial
60k or so
>ath
30M (would have been about 19M after taxes if I'd realized it all) in jan 25
>current
7.2M

>biggest fumble
Not selling t r u m p at 60 (had bought at 3, ended up selling at 20. 10M upnl 'made' and gone in under a week). Runner-up: getting hooked on perps after 10/10 and gambling away another 5M trying to make back my summer port highs.

>biggest disappointment
Being an 8 figga nigga well into last summer and still staying 90% in crypto instead of just socking a few mil into VT and finally relaxing. It's incomprehensible to me that I could realize and even vastly surpass my dream of 9 years (to retire, to be fuck you rich) and then have so much time (9 months or so in 2025) to lock in any of those gains and still to utterly fail to do so. Thinking about my taxes was an achilles heel for me because I would keep seeing my port at an ATH, then do the mental math on the taxes I'd owe if I realized it all, then be mad that my real net worth after taxes was really 30% lower than it was on paper, and then I'd resolve to make another 1.3x so I could 'make back' the money I just felt I'd lost doing the mental math. But doing that would just create another paper ATH that taxes would eat into again, so the chase never ended.

61894794

61894827

Bitcoin financier
NFT inspector
Memecoin analysis

61894882
>>61894746

Lie on your resume

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61895056
>>61894746
Best idea would be to transfer gradually. So you can always say you have experience in the field

Step 1) Work in IT
->
Step 2) Work as a Chef at a big IT company
->
Step 3) Work as a Chef in a Bank
->
Step 4) Work in Finance.

61895074
why not hack for money?
Are you a n00b?

61895089
Solution architect and get a qualification. Your technical background will stand you well but you'll need experience to get an actual SA role, so in your current or next job, thrust yourself into solution architect tasks and then write your cv like you formally changed roles

item.title: Wut Gud out of Pumped Dead Coins? — 16 replies — 40.3/hr
item.content:encoded:
Wut Gud out of Pumped Dead Coins?

Open thread • Replies: 16 • Updated: 2026-02-24 09:38 UTC

OP

HBAR - seems to actually do something, though I am not sure what. Something about Lemon and all the crypto problems being solved - nobody uses it though. Least embarrassing price action on list

ALGO - tranny dump already happened, was leading DiFi platform and was pretty decent for dApps. Dead now that all of that is dead.

ICP - muh Caffeine app builder and distributed compute. Only "real" token to do a 1/1000x (2k -> $2)

LINK - honestly, I am not sure what LINK does, something about oracles and sending JSON objects

GOLD - more gooder if Iran bombed?

XRP - I don't know what XRP does, is it like a replacement for USDC for replacing FedWire? Banks aren't ready to adopt it yet and still use USDC. Also not sure what it does.

???

Serious question though, which of these or similar can pump?

Also, if you want to tell me what they do, I would genuinely appreciate it. I only really understand ALGO and ICP.

Early replies (first 3)

61890916
>>61890886
definitely not QNT

61890935
>>61890886
>tfw no clussy
Also
>LINK - honestly, I am not sure what LINK does, something about oracles and sending JSON objects
We're still so fucking early

61891060
Banks are adopting Ripple atable coins. Not CRP. Although there is an option to ise On Demand Liquidity which replies on XRP. Obviously this is supplemental at best and can't supplant transferring actually USD available.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61891937
>>61890886
Imo buying across any mix of the following will be solid longterm:
XRP, QNT, CC, XDC, ALGO (possibly dead, but in quantum age may shine for sake of superior tech), DAG, HBAR, XLM, SUI, SEI, APT, FLR, ONDO, NOM, ADA, HYPE, SOL, POL, ATOM, DAG, AAVE, DOT, VET, ZRO, RED, HYPE.

Here is a pretty good rundown of the XRP use cases at present from specifically Ripple's operation perspective:
https://ripple.com/insights/institutional-defi-on-xrpl-scaling-real-world-finance-with-xrp-at-the-core/

61891947
>>61891060
Ripple's whole strategy is (just like RLUSD launching on Eth and moving to XRPL) to meet the liquidity where it is and move it to the XRPL. Multiple banks already use XRP but many cannot until Clarity passes. XRPL optimizes using XRP and minted assets autobridge using it between different stable coin or minted asset issuances etc.

61891961
>>61890935
Link doesn't do ANYTHING. It has ZERO utility and no one who invests in it even understands it, they just hear names that CLL has fireside chats with and presume this translates to token value despite it not doing so. The coin exists as a literally unnecessary rent seeker fee insertion. It doesn't solve efficiencies or have a basis for use, it is literally just specific jewry

61892018
>>61890886
A LUST PROVOKING VIDEO?!?!

FUCK YEAH!!!

61892452
>>61890886
>bitches will dress like clowns and dance like retards and will make 5 or 6 digits monthly while you wage like a slave for almost nothing

i am in Hell

61892733
>>61890886
Most of those chains are kinda dead now that DeFi and Dapps are old news, but there are--supposedly--a dozen or so council member use cases being worked on by Hedera council members, some of which are transferable, so could be adopted by other enterprises. That seems interesting. Repsol and Fed Ex are recent members and all new members are required to have a use case they are working on, and supply chains and energy tracking seem good fits for DLTs. Will take a looooong time, though, of course.
I really don't know if crypto has another pump-n-dump fad like NFTs, DeFi, Dapps etc left in it. It really might just be the long wait for mainstream institutional adoption (another reason why I rate Hedera over most others).

61892748
>>61892452
She is top 10% in looks genetically, 1% via not being fat and knowing how to appeal professionally.

If she were a male, she would be benching 315 for reps at sub 8% BF, running 3 miles in 18 minutes at 6'1 with a 130 IQ and working a 200k+ job, and that's without connections.

Some people have it easy, but it isn't gender-related. Average women get discarded at 35 at best. It's brutal.

>>61891060
So is that Ripples' value prop? As mentioned, I do see banks trying to do wires via USDC (and then convert back to USD on both sides). Is XRP pretty much offering that. Thread was serious insofar that I really want to understand what each of these coins is trying to supposedly do. ALGO is the clearest for me (distributed apps), but that whole market died.

>>61891937
Going to go read this, brb.

>>61891937
Any preferences in that list - that's a long-ass list and I am maybe vaguely familiar with half at most.

61892764
>>61892733
>I really don't know if crypto has another pump-n-dump fad like NFTs, DeFi, Dapps etc left in it
That was the real issue with this cycle, there was no hype. Just Bitcoin-led, muh instituional adoption, zero other narrative.

61893117
>>61892748
It is a long list sort of intentionally so that I am not shilling anything. I think 99% of crypto will be valueless and a lot of it is reaching the runway end in the next year or two, especially with clarity, but a few dozen will thrive and emerge at minimum and of those I think are strong, this list if bought across in a diverse way, I think would more or less guarantee if crypto succeeds you do very well also.

you know how when you go to a convenience store and all the different scratch-offs have different names but they're all exactly the same thing? fancy packaging for what appears to be different themes but all designed to trick you out of your money

item.title: European funds for an american — 25 replies — 23.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
European funds for an american

Open thread • Replies: 25 • Updated: 2026-02-24 08:57 UTC

OP

I want to put 20% of my account in foreign, but not all foreign is created equal.

I predicted the rise in the polish economy. It's very simple, a homogenous white country free from communism is always going to become rich. A diverse country full of communists like Canada and South Africa is going to get worse and worse.

I also predicted that the real-estate market in Croatia would sky rocket due to whites fleeing countries like the UK. I was right.

So.... are there any good mutual/index funds that target the white regions of Europe, that an American can invest in? Is there a Balkans fund? A Baltic fund? Norway/Finland fund (not Sweden or Denmark)? I do not want to invest in the UK, France, Germany, or Spain.

Early replies (first 3)

61890485
>finland
>white

61890499
>please buy my bag
nein. Death to every communist, that includes every single member of a political party, everyone over 50, every bureaucrat and every single subsidized "private" which in europe is every company.

61890518
No fucking way those numbers on finland are right. I live in Helsinki and it’s like 25% brown.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61890524
>>61890472
You are correct about Poland but everybody knew and knows about Poland but nobody wants to talk about why they've been the hottest economy in Europe for 15 years (white and Christian).

Anyway. You've never heard of EPOL?
I've owned the Polish index tracker ETFs for 8 years and it has done nicely.

Otherwise, Baltics do have stock markets but they are Frontier markets (this is below emerging markets) and you basically can't buy them if you're not in the country.

Norway invests in U.S. stocks. So does Sweden and their banks. Hottest Swedish bank stock is 100% invested in NYSE traded companies. So it's circular. If you invest in European banks or Norway you're actually buying U.S. stocks with extra steps. EPOL is heavily weighted towards Polish banks and you guessed it - they all hold U.S. company stocks.

European Bank customers are just a source of capital to invest in the New York Stock Exchange. And I'm an insider so I know.

If you want an actual good EU based investment buy WDEF. European defense spending will be hot for 15 years. Otherwise buy Spotify and the upcoming revolut IPO.

61890543
>>61890524
Any funds for manufacturing from the regions I mentioned in the OP, or medical services?
Medical services will always be the last to go even under socialism since Europeans will bankrupt their country with debt before they let a hospital go bankrupt.

61890855
>>61890543
You clearly don't understand the region. You're way out of your depth and element. I'm sorry but it would take me hours to explain this to you.
>t. American in Latvia who knows Poland pretty well (dated a Polish chick and been there many times).
You assume Eastern Europe has the economic model of America or Germany, just poorer and white. You're way off.

61890868
>>61890472
>France
>85%
lmaoooo
this is the 1972 census?

61890982
>>61890524
This map is from 10 or 15 years ago, it's actually changing rapidly now. Im from a small town and back then i haven't ever saw any foreign looking face apart from an occasional gypsy. Now we have filipino, indian, and central asian "guest" workers coming here to the middle of nowhere.

61890989
>>61890868
France is pretty much 100% white outside of Paris and the south

61891003
>>61890989
not at all. Even the smallest, most remote villages are chokefull of shitskins. There isn't a single STREET in the countryside not populated with at least 2-3 shitskins/niggers.
I know becuz i live in one.

61891134
>>61890472
>a homogenous white country free from communism
not Sweden

61891154
>>61890855
I have friends who moved to Croatia. Reason? White flight from the UK. Highly productive middle class white people pouring out of one area and into another, means good things for one economy and bad things for the other. It's no different than watching the small cities that surround Akron, Cleveland, Chicago, Detroit, Oakland, Baltimore, etc... All get richer and richer and have better and better economies due to all of the whites in those cities pouring out into the surrounding areas.

You say it's not that simple, yet I've told people this will happen and for 30 years, I've been right. I watched the real estate market in Croatia skyrocket into the stratosphere. I've also made a lot of money on real-estate outside of Cleveland and Akron just by investing in the white flight destinations.

61891164
>>61890868
This is in fact, old data.

>>61891134
Yes. That's why I said funds that invest in Norway and Finland, but not Denmark and Sweden. I know Finland isn't really Nordic but they're next door.

61891236
>>61891154
That's fine but from the average person's perspective you can't understand the bigger economic picture and appreciate the vast differences in market size and capital flows.
Life for average people may be more or less similar in Croatia and England but the English stock exchange is in another universe compared to these small economies.
As I said, I'm an American living in Latvia. My life is better in Latvia. I'm just a normal guy. The top 1% and .01% would see things quite differently. Where does one park $100,000,000 in the Baltics?
Answer: you don't. And downstream from that is YOU don't get to invest $50,000 in an Estonia market ETF either. These are frontier markets not even as developed as Brazil or India.

61891243
>>61891003
Euskadi

61891374
>>61891236
I think real-estate, and downstream from that medical services, are pretty simple by and large because they're mostly just a matter of predicting the migration patterns of middle class white people, while avoiding the political behavior of lumpenprole voters. At a bare minimum investing in medical services and realestate are a safe bet in any communist free white flight destination.

Question then becomes, what financial products are available to me that resemble that in any way.

There's a fund called NHCBHFFT that invests in real estate in estonia, for example.

61891396
>>61890472
>I do not want to invest in the UK
FTSE100 has been outperforming the S&P500 for a while now but okay

61891622
>>61891396

The massive white flight that has already taken place and has been accelerating, looks exactly how things looked for Detroit, Chicago, Oakland, Baltimore, etc...

Ghettofication is an economy killer. Because people ignore it and it makes people irrational, that is the area an investor can exploit.

61892062
>>61890472
Brown migration is stagnating across Europe and so is the birthrate of migrants of the 2nd/3rd generation. The number of migrants are not big enough to not be outbred in the long run.

61892245
>>61890472

Now Bulgarian gypsies are also abroad and the roles are reversed, lol (except for France, that's only getting worse).

61892365
>>61892062
sounds like copium

61892695
>>61892062
White flight is the real economy killer. Again, look at all the places already mentioned. Niggers in america don't have exceptional birthrates but once they're 20% of a city everyone else runs away. Same as true for states and countries. Most nigger cities in America have half the population they had the in 60s. Akron and Cleveland have lost about half of their population due to white flight.

61892982
>>61890855
This.
I’m polish and I can explain a bit just to give a gist.
Poland’s “capitalist” period started in ‘89 so to this day the biggest companies included in WIG20 are completely controlled by National Treasury. So 8 of them constitute about 55% of the index.
So mind you by loading up on indexes you’re not really buying innovation rather iron clad businesses that aren’t really growth oriented.
Let’ take an example of searching for growth sectors like everyone talks about polish developers so it would be safe to assume that IT stuff has growth potential.
And here the biggest IT company is CD project which makes fucking games a dying industry that will be killed by small teams with ai making indie games.
Rest of well known IT firms are privately owned or controlled by ventures.
It’s hard to really find good stuff I personally think you should search for companies making tangible products or services example solar panels, beauty sector, pharma.
We’ve got a lot of ecomerce, construction, pharma/cosmetics, news outlets. Not really innovative stuff.

I mean I wish it was different but really if someone made something meaningful here he would be molested to death by venture capital like CVC Capital Partners and eventually cave in take cash run and live a beautiful trad life in Bielsko Biała.

61893067
>>61892982
Cont.
So to comparing to the US, Poland is a polar opposite.
In the US Capital lobbies politics. In Poland the only people who can lobby are foreign players and people with political power. And this political power has more influence on the stock market while in the US stock market and capital makes politics.
The end communist era ripples through Poland up to this day. The people responsible for the transition made themselves very powerful and control the capital to this day. The good news it that their descendants are retarded beyond comprehension and will be unable to maintain power.

61895024
>>61892695
They will just flee from one city to another, Germans aren't moving from Germany to go to fucking Poopland lol

61879944

61879999
>>61879836
What is your current occupation anon? Nothing revealing but in general etc...the exercise price of the warrants is $15...trading currently at less than a dollar it seems like a confusing deal...at this point if one likes the company wouldn't shares be the move? I did some modeling around warrant prices if the shares price goes to xyz and that is very interesting...also speaking of interesting what's the deal with the alleged cusip similarity to the old bbbyq shares?

61880091
>>61879999
Financial system. I am not asking you to hold those warrants until they are exercised. I am asking you to hold them and sell the warrants when we can realize a substantial profit. Nice quads.

61881477
>>61880091
Interesting. Wouldn't trading the warrants implicitly come with a short term capital gains tax insofar as its impossible to hold them over a year at this point? Would have to be some pretty fair gains to offset that 40% hit...anyways doesn't the warrants increasing in price also imply that the shares have gone up in price as well? I ran some informal modeling estimates using black scholes with iv, roughly .65 years to expiry and this is what I came up with: 15.5 bbby share price = 4.50ish warrant price...25 share price/12ish warrant price...60 share price/45ish warrant price...100 share price/85ish warrant price...200 share price 185ish warrant price...I make no claim as to the veracity of these numbers, just for fun. Anyways what do you see happening to the bbby stock price for these warrants to be worthwhile? Am I thinking on the right track in general?

It's like the worst insult was being called gay way back, then it was subverted (actually gay is cool), then it became retarded, then it got subverted (actually retarded is cool because you're not trying), then it become autistic, then it became subverted (actually it's interesting to be autistic), now it's random baby talk by gen alpha (mog, cortisol spike, chopped, unc, lil bro, frame, aura farming, 67, incel, cuk). Now it's being subverted by people overusing the terms even if they don't apply to anyone or anything in the context at all. Someone not having sex for a week = incel. Someone having a slightly embarrassing moment (cortisol spike), someone better looking walking past (mogged), doing something that's barely good (aura farming), having a strong presence even if it's completely autistic and retarded (frame). Or like when old people started wearing skateboard shirts having no clue what it was, or everyone and their dog wearing an off white shirt. People make shit gay eventually, it's a universal law.
